access: A character who is a member of the Pathfinder Society has access to this option.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Forced Entry](/Feats.aspx?ID=1126) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=12) pg. 112 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Pathfinder Agent](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=13)

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3); [Pathfinder Agent Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=871)

**Access**
A character who is a member of the Pathfinder Society has access to this option.

</column>

---

You are trained to preserve the archaeological value of your location when entering. You don’t take a penalty to [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) doors, windows, or containers without a crowbar. If you roll a success on a check to Force Open, you get a critical success instead.
name: Forced Entry
prerequisite: Expert in Athletics; Pathfinder Agent Dedication

You don’t take a penalty to Force Open doors, windows, or containers without a crowbar. If you roll a success on a check to Force Open, you get a critical success instead.
